timeline.message: Refactor(Java): Updating Alert to retrieve the Black Duck data as needed instead of syncing the project/user data with the database.

timeline.bodyText: Can this class be deleted since the BlackDuckProviderDataAccessor now exists.  And in the past DefaultProviderDataAccessor was the only ProviderDataAccessor implementation once we removed support for Polaris.
timeline.author: psantos1113

replies.bodyText: We want to keep this class around along with the provider data tables. The changes I made to this class for now should render this class unused until we decide to delete it.
replies.author: jamesrichard91

replies.bodyText: I do think we want to add @Deprecated here just to make sure people don't try to use this whether in tests or production.
replies.author: gkillough

timeline.bodyText: providerConfigID and providerConfigId are both used in this class. We should stick to one capitalization strategy.
timeline.author: gkillough

timeline.bodyText: We should delete all of these commented annotations and worry about re-adding them if we ever want to implement the interface again.
timeline.author: gkillough

timeline.message: Refactor (Java): removing commented annotations, fixing capitalization inconsistencies.

timeline.bodyText: For API's we have a response NOT_IMPLEMENTED. is there some similar runtime exception we could throw here?
timeline.author: bamandel

replies.bodyText: We don't want this to throw an exception. We want this class to be used in place of the DefaultProviderDataAccessor so that it will have minimal impact
replies.author: jamesrichard91

timeline.bodyText: All other methods return a List. Why is this one specifically a set? I feel we should return all lists or all sets to be consistent
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.message: Updating the ProviderDataAccessorTestIT to resolve compilation errors. Adding TODO to update the tests
